doc.after: Arens considers the belief in cannibalism to be a universal phenomenon that has been exhibited in all inhabited regions of the world 14 He expresses his view that all cultures subcultures religions sects secret societies and every other possible human association have been labeled anthropophagic by someone 14 He notes that accusations of socially sanctioned cannibalism in a society typically arise from an alternative society with whom they are often in conflict As evidence he notes that pagan Romans labelled the early Christians as cannibals despite the lack of any evidence for this and subsequently Christians in Medieval Europe labelled Jews as cannibals again despite any corroborating evidence 15
